title: Data suggests there could be 38 million unused bikes in UK
content:
There could be as many as 38 million unused bikes sitting in homes around the UK amid the current bike shortage.

A study by the Bike Club, a kids' bike monthly subscription service, found that 34% of British adults have at least one adult bike that has fallen out of use while 15% have at least one kids' bike that's no longer used.

When that data is extrapolated, it suggests there could be over 38 million unused bikes in the UK, which is more than the number needed to meet current demand.

Within that figure, 7.9 million adults have at least one unused kids' bike with many having as many as three. That equates to 12.5 million unused children's bikes across the country.

The study also showed that just under half of adults with children between five and 11 years old have an unused child's bike with more than 10% storing them for over four years. The biggest offenders were in the Midlands where 14% of adults have stored kids bikes for over 10 years.

The Bike Club's research said that 20% of those with unused kids' bikes said it was because 'it's too much hassle to sell'.

While we clearly have to be careful about extrapolating data, the study shows the potential of the circular economy to help reduce strain on the industry. 

James Symes, co-founder of the Bike Club, said: 'While interest in cycling has soared during the pandemic, 2020 and the start of 2021 have been marred by a severe shortage of bikes as retailers across the UK have struggled to meet unprecedented levels of demand.

'With over an estimated 38 million unused bikes in the UK, we must look at other ways in which we can meet the current demand for cycling.'

He added, 'We are proud to have created a zero-hassle solution for anyone looking to unload an unwanted kids bike. Our reCycle scheme gives people the ability to sell their kids bike, get it picked up from their doorstep for free and make some money. 

'This means it's great for their pocket and great for the environment too. Upon collection, our expert mechanics put it through a comprehensive safety check, change any worn out parts and then give it a new lease of life with one of our lovely members.'

For more information on the Bike Club, visit thebikeclub.co.uk
